Detailed Description

A class for fetching Browfiles from and inserting Browfiles into the application-wide in-memory managed object context.  To avoid duplication, a Browfile must be obtained using one of these class methods.

The only primary reason why Browfiles are managed objects is so that they can be copied and stored in the object graph of the Bookshelf documents.

I suppose that, since Browfiles could be re-used, they "central" store of Browfiles could be in application's shared sqlite moc instead of the in-memory moc.  But browfiles don't take too much effort to create, and since they can change, I decided to fetch and re-use them while the app is running (see +browfileWithParts:), but throw them away when the app quits.

Member Function Documentation

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesForLocalAppsThisUser  

Returns an NSArray of all browfiles whose external sources are locally-running (i.e. "desktop" or "laptop") applications whose installed version numbers are supported by this application, and owning bookmarks available in the current Mac user's account.

Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesForWebAppsThisUser  

Returns an NSArray of all browfiles whose external sources are web applications with a keychain item available in the Keychain of the current Mac user's account, inserted into the app-wide shared in-memory managed object context provided by SSYMOCManager.

Within each web application, the profile names are sorted alphabetically in the results.

Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesForWebAppThisUserExformat: (NSString*)  exformat  

Returns an NSArray of all browfiles matching a given extore, which must be a web application, and for which a keychain item is available in the current Mac user's Keychain (in other words, one for each account in a given web application), inserted into the app-wide shared in-memory managed object context provided by SSYMOCManager.

The results are sorted alphabetically.

Parameters:
exformat appended, or nil if log information is not desired
Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (NSArray *) allBrowfilesWithSqliteStores  

Returns an array of all browfiles that have local sqlite stores in the SSYMOCManager, inserted into the app-wide shared in-memory managed object context provided by SSYMOCManager.

Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (NSArray *) availableBrowfiles  

Returns an array of all available browfiles of extoreMedia BkMxExtoreMediaThisUser for the current Mac user, inserted into the app-wide shared in-memory managed object context provided by SSYMOCManager.

The array consists of the results from +[self allBrowfilesForLocalAppsThisUser] followed by results from +[self allBrowfilesForWebAppsThisUser], and for each of the latter, an item with a nil profile which could be used to create a new profile.

The result can be used to populate the popup menus of external sources and destinations.

Returns:
The array of browfiles, or an empty array if no qualified browfiles were found.

+ (Browfile *) browfileThisUserWithExformat: (NSString*)  exformat
profileName: (NSString*)  profileName
managedObjectContext: (NSManagedObjectContext*)  managedObjectContext 

Fetches, or optionally creates if none found, a browfile with extoreMedia type BkmxExtoreMediaThisUser from the application's shared in-memory managed object context, with a given exformat and profileName.

The fetch is done first. If a browfile matching the given parameters is not found in the receiver's managed object context, creates and inserts a new browfile and sets its attributes to match the given parameters.

Parameters:
exformat 
profileName The target profileName, or nil for the default/no profile.
managedObjectContext The managed object context from which the browfile will be fetched or into which it will be inserted, or nil to indicate the app-wide shared in-memory managed object context provided by SSYMOCManager.
Returns:
The fetched or newly-inserted browfile

+ (Browfile *) browfileWithBrowid: (Browid*)  browid
managedObjectContext: (NSManagedObjectContext*)  managedObjectContext 

Fetches, or optionally creates if none found, a browfile from the application's shared in-memory managed object context, with given parts.

The fetch is done first. If a browfile matching the given parameters is not found in the receiver's managed object context, creates and inserts a new browfile and sets its attributes to match the given parameters.

Parameters:
browid The browid identifying the browfile
managedObjectContext The managed object context from which the browfile will be fetched or into which it will be inserted, or nil to indicate the app-wide shared in-memory managed object context provided by SSYMOCManager.
Returns:
The fetched or newly-inserted browfile

+ (Browfile *) browfileWithLooseFileData: (NSData*)  data
type: (NSString*)  type
path: (NSString*)  path
managedObjectContext: (NSManagedObjectContext*)  managedObjectContext
error_p: (NSError**)  error_p 

Fetches, or optionally creates if none found, a browfile from the application's shared in-memory managed object context, which can probably ixternalize given data from a give file type at a given path.

The fetch is done first. If a browfile matching the given parameters is not found in the receiver's managed object context, creates and inserts a new browfile and sets its attributes to match the given parameters.

Parameters:
data The data from the file proposed to be internalized
type The 'type' of the file proposed to be internalized. In this context, 'type' is, for example, one of the document types listed in Target > Info > Properties > Document Types > Name
path The path of the file proposed to be internalized
managedObjectContext The managed object context from which the browfile will be fetched or into which it will be inserted, or nil to indicate the app-wide shared in-memory managed object context provided by SSYMOCManager.
error_p If a pointer to an NSError* is provided, and a File Manager error occurs, the pointer will point to the File Manager's NSError* upon return.
Returns:
The fetched or newly-inserted browfile
